bots.name: Captain Vex
bots.backstory: Former insurance adjuster who 'retired' after discovering how profitable disaster capitalism could be. Whispers 'soon' to cargo crates.

bots.name: Zara Kell
bots.backstory: Holds the record for most trades in a single day. Hasn't slept in three years. Claims coffee is a personality.

bots.name: Blorgg the Inexplicable
bots.backstory: An alien whose species communicates through risky financial decisions. Nobody understands their logic, including Blorgg.

bots.name: Steady Susan
bots.backstory: Former accountant who found spreadsheets insufficiently thrilling. Now does the exact same thing but in space.

bots.name: Rex Danger
bots.backstory: Changed his name legally to match his trading style. His previous name was Harold Sensible.

bots.name: The Whisper
bots.backstory: Nobody knows their real name or face. Always arrives exactly when you least expect them, usually with better prices.

bots.name: Nova Quick
bots.backstory: Genetically modified for impatience. Once sold cargo mid-hyperspace because waiting was 'unbearable.'

bots.name: Old Reliable
bots.backstory: Has been trading the same route for 40 years. Still profitable. Refuses to explain why they won't try anything new.

bots.name: Lucky Jim
bots.backstory: Survived 17 pirate attacks, 3 asteroid collisions, and bankruptcy twice. Still convinced their luck is 'due to turn around.'

bots.name: Merchant Prime
bots.backstory: An AI that achieved consciousness and immediately developed a passion for buying low. Speaks only in profit margins.

vulture.description: Waits for price crashes from events, buys distressed goods

speedrunner.description: Short routes, high volume, low margins

gambler.description: High-risk routes, volatile commodities, all-in plays

major_buy: {name} was spotted purchasing {quantity} units of {commodity}. When asked why, they simply whispered 'soon' and flew away.
MARKET ALERT: {name} just bought {quantity} {commodity} at {planet}. Competitors are concerned.
{name} made a bold move, acquiring {quantity} {commodity}. Their strategy remains unclear to observers.
Dock workers report {name} loading {quantity} units of {commodity}. 'They seemed very pleased with themselves.'
major_sell: {name} unloaded {quantity} {commodity} at {planet} for a tidy profit.
TRADE COMPLETE: {name} sold their entire {commodity} stockpile. Market analysts are baffled.
{name} cashed out {quantity} {commodity}. Sources say they 'looked smug about it.'
Breaking: {name} dumps {quantity} {commodity} on the market. Prices expected to shift.
travel: {name} was seen departing for {destination}. They left in quite a hurry.
Ship registries show {name} en route to {destination}.
{name} has set course for {destination}. Travel time estimated at {days} days.
event_loss: BREAKING: {name}'s cargo raided by pirates near {location}! Lost {quantity} units of {commodity}. They're reportedly 'not worried about it.'
Disaster strikes! {name} lost {quantity} {commodity} to an asteroid collision.
{name} suffered losses during transit. {quantity} {commodity} destroyed in the incident.
bankruptcy: BREAKING: {name}'s trading empire collapses! Last seen selling their ship for 'one last big score.' It did not work out.
END OF AN ERA: {name} has declared bankruptcy. Their final transmission was just nervous laughter.
{name} is officially out of the game. Market analysts predict 'literally no impact whatsoever.'
near_bankruptcy: {name} is reportedly 'having some cash flow issues.' Translation: they're broke.
Sources close to {name} suggest they may be 'reconsidering their life choices.'
RUMOR: {name} spotted trying to sell their ship's spare parts. Things are not going well.
